channel.title: World News, Latest World News, Breaking News and Headlines Today | Hindustan Times
channel.description: World News - Find latest world news and headlines today based on politics, crime, entertainment, sports, lifestyle, technology and many more at Hindustan Times.
channel.copyright: Copyright (C) 2019 HT Media Limited. All Rights Reserved.

image.title: World News, Latest World News, Breaking News and Headlines Today | Hindustan Times

item.title: Galwan soldier as Olympic torchbearer: China dismisses India’s anger
item.description: China made light of India’s outrage at its decision to field a military officer involved in the Galwan Valley clash as a torchbearer for the ongoing Winter Olympics, saying not too much should be read into it politically.

item.title: Anti-mandate protests in Canada: Emergency declared in Ottawa
item.description: A state of emergency has been declared in the Canadian capital of Ottawa as a protest by truckers’ camping there entered its tenth day.

item.title: China: In a U-turn, Peng Shuai denies sexual assault allegation against CPC official
item.description: Tennis star Peng Shuai had appeared to accuse former vice-premier Zhang Gaoli, in a Chinese social media blogpost in November of coercing her into having sex.

item.title: Google changing logo of Chrome browser after 8 years. All you need to know
item.description: Google Chrome logo: From 2008 until now, the Chrome logo has been getting gradually simpler. What started out as a shiny, three-dimensional emblem has been squashed down into a 2D symbol.

item.title: Australia to reopen its borders to international tourists on February 21. Conditions apply
item.description: Australia shut its borders for foreign tourists at the beginning of the Covid-19 pandemic to contain the virus from spreading rapidly.

item.title: Pak PM Imran Khan expresses support to China on Xinjiang, Hong Kong, Tibet
item.description: Khan is visiting China to attend the opening ceremony of the Beijing Winter Olympics and meet the top Chinese leadership from political and business areas.

item.title: Ottawa mayor declares state of emergency over 'out of control' truckers' protest
item.description: The protesters, who first reached the capital on January 29, have parked their big rigs on city streets and put up tents and temporary shacks -- paralyzing the capital to the consternation of officials and the mounting frustration of many residents.

item.title: Ukraine plays down Russian invasion risk
item.description: If Moscow does opt for a full-scale attack, the invading force could take Kiev and topple president in a matter of 48 hours: American officials.

item.title: Ukraine crisis: New satellite images show S-400, Iskander missiles in Belarus
item.description: Russia has repeatedly denied claims that it is planning to attack Ukraine. Kyiv too has sought to play down "apocalyptic predictions", but western countries claim that Moscow will increase troop deployment till Putin gets the firepower he needs for a full-scale invasion.

item.title: China, Pakistan review CPEC project
item.description: In the past, India strongly rejected references made to Jammu and Kashmir in a statement by Pakistan and China and asserted that the union territory as well as Ladakh have been and will remain its integral and inalienable part.

item.title: Kim Jong Un keeps aiming his missiles at this 'most hated rock'
item.description: Alsom Island, located 18 kilometers off North Korea’s northeastern coast, has been targeted in more than 25 missile strikes since 2019.

item.title: ‘State of emergency’ in Ottawa over Covid-19 protest
item.description: The protesters, who first reached the capital on January 29, have parked their big rigs on city streets and put up tents and temporary shacks -- paralyzing the capital to the consternation of officials and the mounting frustration of many residents.

item.title: China tightens rules in Macao to avoid Hong Kong-type unrest: Report
item.description: Under the plan, Macao, designated a "special administrative region" by Beijing, will “formulate positive and negative lists of swearing allegiance to the SAR and relevant qualification examination mechanisms to regulate the way legislators perform their duties”.

item.title: Not sending forces to start a war with Russia: US on Ukraine crisis
item.description: Ukraine on Sunday insisted the chance of resolving the soaring tensions with Russia through diplomacy remained greater than that of an attack.

item.title: Imran Khan condoles Lata Mangeshkar's death, says loss for subcontinent
item.description: Lata Mangeshkar, known as India's nightingale, was cremated with full state honours at Shivaji Park in Mumbai.

item.title: Xi Jinping, Pakistan PM discuss cooperation areas, India
item.description: China firmly supports Pakistan in safeguarding its sovereignty and fighting terrorism, President Xi Jinping told Pakistani PM Imran Khan.

item.title: Prince Charles leads tribute on 70-year anniversary of Queen Elizabeth's ascension to throne
item.description: “We are deeply conscious of the honour represented by my mother's wish”, Prince Charles said in a statement.

item.title: Canada: Priests, devotees scared as temples vandalised, burgled in Toronto area
item.description: Priests and devotees at temples in the Greater Toronto Area are in a state of fear after cash stolen from donation boxes and even ornaments adorning idols stolen.

item.title: Tibetan groups in Canada protest China’s human rights violation
item.description: As the Beijing Olympics have commenced, Tibetan groups in Canada have protested occupation of the plateau by China and condemned the IOC’s ‘complicity in sports washing’ human rights violations there.

item.title: Covid-19: Anti-mandate agitation spreads to many cities in Canada
item.description: The so-called Freedom Convoy has shown no signs of vacating Ottawa; Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, who has attacked the protests, has yet to return to the city, after he was moved to an undisclosed location.

item.title: Beijing Olympics: Dutch journalist interrupted on-air by Chinese official, IOC says 'one-off’'
item.description: According to multiple reports, Daas was then dragged away by one official, while his camera was also shut down.

item.title: UK's Camilla: From public shaming to Queen Consort-in-waiting
item.description: In a message to the nation, Queen Elizabeth II praised Camilla's "loyal service", saying she hoped her daughter-in-law will be known as Queen Consort when Charles accedes to the throne.

item.title: Imran Khan holds meetings with Chinese Premier, firms as Pak eyes more loan
item.description: Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan is in China on a four-day visit to attend the opening ceremony of the Beijing Winter Olympics and meet the top Chinese leadership - political and business.

item.title: Australia to allow foreign tourists by Feb-end after two-year lockout: Report
item.description: The hospitality sector in Australia has been hard-hit due to Covid-induced border restrictions and lockdowns.

item.title: 5-year-old Morocco boy trapped in deep well has died
item.description: The boy, Rayan, was pulled out Saturday night by rescuers after a lengthy operation that captivated global attention.

item.title: Iconic tapestry of Picasso's 'Guernica' is back at the UN
item.description: The tapestry was commissioned in 1955 by former US vice president and New York governor Nelson Rockefeller and offered to the UN on loan in 1984.

item.title: UN report: Terror groups have more freedom in Afghanistan now
item.description: The latest report of the UN Security Council on activities of the Islamic State and al-Qaeda and their affiliates said the Taliban have not done anything to limit the activities of foreign terrorists – an assertion that will strengthen suspicions about setup in Kabul in capitals around the world.

item.title: Elizabeth II approves Camilla as ‘Queen Consort’ when Charles is king
item.description: In a letter written to mark the 70th anniversary of her accession to the throne, Elizabeth said the occasion had given her pause to reflect upon the loyalty and affection shown to her by the British public.

item.title: Missing plane found at bottom of lake in Iceland
item.description: Iceland's coastguard said in a statement the plane crashed into Lake Thingvallavatn some 40 km (25 miles) east of the capital, Reykjavik, and was located with the help of an unmanned submarine.

item.title: Prince Andrew to give evidence next month in sex abuse lawsuit: Report
item.description: The Duke of York, who denies accusations that he sexually abused Giuffre two decades ago when she was 17, will speak under oath in London, the Daily Telegraph newspaper reported.

item.title: Russia sends nuclear-capable bombers over Belarus amid Ukraine tensions
item.description: The flight followed several similar patrols over Belarus, which borders Ukraine to the north.
